review_blob: This is the beer that Maui Brewings Coconut porter wishes it was. I used to like that beer but the coconut is too subtle. I used to be crazy about it but it seems less coconutty now. This beer on the other hand is everything I wanted in a coconut porter. Its amazing, get it.
beer_name: Oskar Blues / Shamrock Death By Coconut

review_blob: Pours a dark copper brown color with a big thick white head. Aroma is very light. I smells some grass, light malts, thats about it. The taste is light and refreshing but ultimately boring. Light malts, no hops to speak of, watery. Theres a fruity characteristic to it. Unfortunately theres a weird metallic thing I keep getting after every sip that I really dont like.
beer_name: Moab Brewery Dead Horse Amber Ale

review_blob: Pours a dark black color with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet coffee, dark cherries, and lots of vanilla. The taste is initially light coffee followed by oak, vanilla, sweet roasted malts, licorice, and dark chocolate. Overall a really solid stout.

Pours a dark black color with a medium white head. Aroma is dark chocolate and oats. The taste is chocolate, cocoa, oat, and very light hops. It finishes with a bitter burnt malt flavor that I dont find very pleasant. The mouthfeel is soft and creamy with medium carbonation. Pretty good despite the relatively low ABV.
Pours a golden yellow color with a nice sticky white head. Aroma is citrusy hops, honey, and earthy. The taste is medium bodied, not too bitter, some honey malts, citrusy hops. Very good IPA.

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob: Pours a nice amber yellow color with no head. Aroma is sour apples and pear. The taste is decent but very sweet. The barrel aging has added some vanilla and oak flavors that are actually pretty nice. I wish theyd aged it longer and it wasnt such a sugar bomb.
beer_name: Woodchuck Out on a Limb #2 - Spitter Splinter

review_blob: Pours a very light yellow color with light carbonation. It looks like a glass of white wine with a tiny bit of carbonation. Aroma is sour pear. The taste is sweet pear, tequila, sugar, light carbonation. Meh, not great.

Pours a golden yellow color with a nice golden head. Aroma is hops and grass. The taste is bitter. Its exactly what it sounds like, a hoppy lager. Not much malt to speak of. Just grassy hops and lager flavors. Decent.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Hoppy Lager

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob: Pours a golden color with no head and very little carbonation. It looks like white wine. Aroma is apples and yeast. The taste is somewhere between an English cider and a regular cider. Sort of sweet, sort of dry. I like it.

beer_brewer_name: The Traveler Beer Company (formerly House Of Shandy)
review_blob: Pours a super hazy yellow color with a thick, borderline frothy white head that quickly fades away to nothing. Aroma is grapefruit, orange juice, and lemon. The taste is sweet grapefruit, wheat, and lemon. No hope\s or malt flavors are really present. Its like a grapefruit bluemoon with some sweetness added. Decent.
Pours a dark brown/reddish color with no head. The aroma is apples (duh) and malt. The taste is half sweet, half sour. Its like a big malty slightly sour apple juice. Good stuff.
beer_name: J.K.s Northern Neighbour Farmhouse Cider Saskatoon Cuvee

review_blob: Pours a dark brown reddish color with a medium tan head. Aroma is hops, caramel, and wood. The taste consists of earthy hops, dry wood, and every once in a while I get a bit of creamy vanilla. Interesting but I dont love it. Finish is bitter and long. I would have liked more bourbon flavor.

Pours a dark black color with a tiny little head. Aroma is boooooooze, rum, raisins, oak, sugar. The taste is, well, its so much booze. Overwhelming booze. I like pumpkin beers. I like rum. I like Avery for the most part but this? This was not done well in my opinion. Maybe 2014 produced an unusually harsh bash. I loved the Pumpkyn beer they make thats the same strength. This one was just not good. Age it for 10 years and maybe it will have mellowed.

Lets start with the appearance. Perfect 5/5 for an IPA. Crystal clear yellow/orange color with a thick white head that fades slowly, leaving sticky residue all over inside of the glass. It certainly smells nice as well. Lemon hops and floral smells as well. The taste is light and crisp. Good hop flavor without much bitterness. The best way to describe the hops is lemon, along with some rind, a little grassy, delicious. This is a really good IPA. My only knock on it would be thats its pretty one dimensional. Its all about the hops, the malts play very little role in the taste.

Pours a light clear orange color with tiny white head. Aroma is grapefruit right in the face. Sour aroma and hops. The taste is so good. Its exactly what youd think it would taste like. A fresh squeezed grapefruit carefully balanced with hops and a very light malt backbone. The finish is bitter, it reminds me of the white skin on a grapefruit. Overall just a really, really solid beer.

Pours a dark hazy brown color with a tiny off-white head. The aroma is honey water with some barley. The taste is very lagerish, grass, cracker, medium amount of malt, and honey. Its not great but its not terrible either. Sort of reminds me on Honey Brown.
On tap at taste of tops in Tempe. Aroma is sour lemon, funk, grass. The taste is Brett funk, light wine, lemon, wheat, and orange. Pretty decent.

Pours a dark brown/black color with a tiny head. Aroma is sweet dark fruit, Belgian candy sugar, and cherries. The taste is thick and sweet. Lots of Belgian candy sugar, raisins, dark fruits, alcohol and a touch of cherry cough syrup (in a good way). Very good.

Pours a reddish brown color with a tiny white head. Aroma is weird. Maybe some cherry along with some bread? Possible some spices? The taste is weird too. Kind of sweet, some cough syrup taste, a little straw. Its gross. This is not a good beer. Avoid.
beer_name: Blue Moon Short Straw Farmhouse Red Ale

review_blob: Pours a dark black color with a nice tan head. The aroma tells you its a light beer. Smoke and chocolate malts. The taste is medium smoke and dark orange flavored chocolate. Its pretty light and watery. Pretty disappointing. I was hoping for something a little more substantial.
beer_name: Stone Smoked Porter - Chocolate & Orange Peel

review_blob: Had this on tap earlier today at four peaks in Tempe. I think they called it Double Pumpkin Imperial Porter. They serve it to you in a tulip glass that has maybe 10 ounces in it. The appearance is dark black with a tiny tan head. Aroma is chocolate malts, pumpkin and spices. The taste is a lot like the regular pumpkin porter but with more alcohol. Good pumpkin flavor mixed with some burnt malts and alcohol. Overall pretty good.

Pours a very hazy orange yellow color with a nice white head and tons of lacing. Aroma is lemon, almost pineapple, and lots of funk. The taste is very grassy, lots of lemon peel, a dry funkiness, and maybe light orange. I keep getting a weird metallic after-taste that fades quickly but is unpleasant. Its a good Brett beer and certainly doesnt taste like its 8% abv.

Pours a golden amber color with a nice white head. Aroma is orange peel, light malts, light hops. The taste is lightly malty, some sour grain, a little Belgian candy sugar. Super easy to drink, nothing special but also not bad.
beer_name: Blue Moon Rounder Belgian Style Pale

review_blob: Pours a golden lager yellow with a nice white head. It smells exactly like an apple pie. It tastes like a Cinnamon Horchata mixed with a wheat beer. Nice Christmas ale. Dont lie to yourself its good.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: Well I accidentally froze it so that may affect the rating. It pours a hazy yellow orange color with a big thick head. It smells like cranberries and lemonade mixed with some wheat thrown in for good measure. It tastes a lot like cranberries, Im not getting much ginger. Theres a really funky metallic aftertaste that bugs me after every sip. Its decent, not sure about that weird aftertaste.

Pours a thick reddish color with zero head and very very light carbonation. Aroma is cherries, alcohol, honey, and bread. The taste is cherry cough syrup, sweet bread, honey, and alcohol. Too sweet for my tastes. I didnt enjoy this much at all especially for the price of $24. It reminded me of a cheap port wine. It might age well but right now its not enjoyable.

Aroma is kind of weird. Im smelling feet, malts, and something I cant quite put my finger on. Its dirty smelling and unpleasant. Thankfully the taste is better. Light hop bitterness, light alcohol, pretty malty. Not great, not terrible. Perfectly mediocre IPA.

Pours a golden orange color with a thick white head and tons of yeast. I was trying to avoid yeast and I still got a ton. Aroma is pretty nice, mostly grapefruit and citrus hops. The taste is honey, grapefruit rind, and alcohol. Im disappointing with how much alcohol I can taste considering its "only" 8.5%. Just ok, I was hoping for a lot more orange flavor.

Pours a very cloudy, yeasty orange color with a huge white head. Aroma is sour malt and dirty hops. The taste is very watery and light. Theres some earthy hops, a very light malty taste, and a little but of a metallic copper penny finish. Its OK but I wouldnt get it again.

Pours a dark black color with little to no head. The aroma is wonderful. Huge citrus smell along with some burnt malts. The taste is wonderfully balanced, much less sweet than I was expecting at 8.9%. Theres some really nice grapefruit rind hop flavors mixed with very light bitterness from the black malts used. Just really nice.
beer_name: Founders Dark Penance Imperial Black IPA

review_blob: Pours a thick orange with a small white head. Aroma is citrus rinds, resin, and honey. The taste is not at all sweet, moderately bitter, earthy hops, resin and orange peel taste. I like it. Well balanced and on the light end for a double ipa.
beer_name: New Belgium Hop Kitchen #7 - Hop The Pond

review_blob: Pours a thick dark red color with a nice tan head. The aroma is copper penny, grapefruit, citrus rinds, and malt. The taste is everything a good red should be. Medium level of maltiness, citrusy hops, mildly sweet and medium bodied. Long, bitter finish that lasts a long time. Good stuff.

Pours a medium orange color with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is light hops, belgian yeast, bananas, fruit. The taste is lemons, bananas, tasty earthy flavored hops, and belgian candy sugar. Unfortunately theres a bitter metallic aftertaste after every sip that destroys the taste. I like it but I hate the aftertaste.
UPDATED: NOV 17, 2014
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Pours a dark clear copper orange color with a tiny white head. Aroma is sour pumpkin spices. The taste is light a vegetal. Light pumpkin, nutmeg, spices, light malts. This beer doesnt try too hard, its like they just wanted to make a 5% pumpkin beer that was easy to drink and they succeeded.
beer_name: Magic Hat Wilhelm Scream Pumpkin Ale

review_blob: Pours a dark brown color with a small white head that fades quickly and sticks to the side of the glass. Aroma is hazelnuts, caramel, and light chocolate. The taste is bitter cocoa, dark chocolate, and light caramel. Pretty good.

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob: Pours a clear ruby red with no head. It looks like either a light red wine or perhaps red koolaide. The aroma is cider with a hint of cherry medicine. The taste is very sweet and lightly tart. It reminds me of sour cherries or maybe cranberries. Its not bad. Not sour enough to be really interesting and too much sugar for me to have more than one.

Pours a dark copper color with a tiny head. Aroma is light pumpkin and spices. The taste is fresh pumpkin pie, nutmeg, cinnamon, lightly sweet malts. This is my favorite pumpkin beer for a reason. Its cheap, easy to drink, easy to find, and perfectly balanced.

Pours a light orange color with a tiny little head. Aroma is amazing, 10/10. Pumpkin pie, nutmeg, omg I could smell this forever. The taste hits you right in the face with a perfume of pumpkin and spices. Its overwhelming. I think the taste is too full of spices and perfume to be all that enjoyable. In my opinion the taste is overrated. Good pumpkin beer, not my favorite, too much perfume taste for my liking.

Pours a light hazy yellow color with a nice white head. Aroma is sour wheat and lemons. The taste is watered down wheat with a slightly tart finish. Overall a pretty good summer beer. Im pretty surprised.

Pours a dark chocolate brown color with a nice brown head. Aroma is raspberries and chocolate. The taste is actually pretty decent. The raspberries take up most of the flavor. After raspberry there is a very light dark chocolate pretzel thing going on. Actually pretty good. The best one of these weird doughnut beers Ive had.
beer_name: Rogue Voodoo Doughnut Pretzel, Raspberry, and Chocolate Ale

review_blob: Pours a dark brown color with little to no head. Aroma is sweet and malty. The taste is sweet and thick with sugar. Lots of caramel and scotch ale type flavors. Decent.

Pours a golden yellow with a decent amount of floating yeast in the glass. Aroma is solvent, alcohol, pine sol, floor cleaner, maybe a little honey. The taste is slightly sweet grassy harsh alcoholic nail polish remover with a hint of banana. Nasty.
beer_name: Mikkeller / To l Walk on Water

review_blob: Pours a clear golden color with a nice white head. The aroma is floral hops, grass, hay, and light malted barley. The taste is bitter and floral. Decent sweetness to balance the hops but this one is more hoppy than it is malty. Orange and lemon rind bitterness along with alcohol in the finish and good carbonation.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Across America West Coast Double IPA

review_blob: Pours a dark chocolate black color with a nice tan head. Aroma is sweet malts, coffee, cherries, and caramel. The taste is heavy wood, cherry syrup, sticky sweet malts, light coffee, 100% amazing. One of the best beers Ive had in a long time.

Pours a light, slightly hazy yellow color with a tiny white head. Aroma is very light, in fact Im having trouble smelling it. I guess theres some sourness in the smell, that familiar berliner weiss thing, and a hint of peaches. The taste is light a sour. Really light peach taste, grass, sour lemons, so refreshing. I really like this style of beer.

Pours a dark reddish brown color with a nice white head and sticky lacing. Aroma is copper, caramel malts, and earthy hops. The taste is sweet and bitter at the same time with earthy hops, caramel sweet hops, and a light after taste of copper but in a good way? Very good IPA.

My mother in law left some of these in my fridge over the weekend so in the name of science I thought I would review one. The pour is light pee yellow with a small head that disappears almost immediately. The carbonation is on the heavy side. Aroma is sweet corn and grass. The taste....its a crappy lager not much to say. Generally these types of beers are inoffensive and very watery. This is definitely watery but it also has a spoiled off-taste. Just gross.

Pours a very dark blackish brown with 0 head. It almost looks like a very dark. Theres a decent amount of sediment in the bottom of the bottle. Aroma is sweet candied sugar, maple, and caramel. The taste is huge malty sweetness and alcohol, followed by an aftertaste of maple syrup. This is a big, thick, beer and I dont think I could have more than 1 bottle.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel quinoxe du Printemps
